subsection.name: Q 1.1 Where do I get help with Cayenne?
subsection.p: Free Cayenne support is provided by its authors and Cayenne user community via cayenne-user mailing list. For details how to subscribe and for earlier archives, go to http://objectstyle.org/cayenne/lists.html. Commerical support and consulting services are also available directly from the authors of Cayenne.

subsection.name: Q 1.2 How do I report a bug that I found in Cayenne?
subsection.p: Cayenne is using JIRA Issue Tracking system. Follow this link to submit Cayenne-related bugs.

subsection.name: Q 1.3 How does Cayenne compare to XYZ O/R tool?
subsection.p: There is a growing Wiki page at http://c2.com/cgi-bin/wiki?ObjectRelationalToolComparison originally started by Cayenne team. Please go there for such information, and to participate in building the comparison.

subsection.name: Q 1.4 What License covers Cayenne source?
subsection.p: Cayenne license is a BSD/Apache style license. In short - source code is avaliable, modifications are allowed, modifications and products built with Cayenne can be distributed unrestricted. The only requirement - give Cayenne authors a written credit when distributing Cayenne or using Cayenne in a derivative work.

subsection.name: Q 1.5 Cayenne History
subsection.p: Idea of Cayenne was conceived back in 2001 by a few programmers in Atlanta, USA. Current version is based on that original idea and is under active development since December 2001.
Later two of the original authors of Cayenne (Andrus and Misha) started a company called ObjectStyle LLC to provide commercial support and consulting services for the product.
Core product is fully OpenSource under the most liberal license, and will stay that way. Right now Cayenne has a growing international user and developer community.
